intro: Elaeocarpus ledermannii var. timoniifolius, commonly known as the Timoniifolius elaeocarpus, is a tropical evergreen tree native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Elaeocarpaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that are often clustered at the base of the stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits that contain a single seed. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
